# Implementation Plan: FutureList - Personal Wishlist App

**Branch**: `001-future-list-app` | **Date**: 2025-11-06 | **Spec**: [spec.md](./spec.md)
**Input**: Feature specification from `/specs/001-future-list-app/spec.md`

**Note**: This document is generated by the `/speckit.plan` command. See `.specify/templates/commands/plan.md` for the execution workflow.

## Summary

FutureList is a minimalist personal wishlist app for capturing and organizing future activities (movies, restaurants, trips, books). Built with Next.js 15 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS 4, the app provides secure authentication via Supabase, responsive design across all devices, and a delightful UX focused on immediate capture with minimal friction. No automated testing per project constitution - all validation is manual.

**Primary Requirements**:
- Quick item capture (title + category) in <10 seconds
- Secure user authentication (email/password, 6+ characters)
- Category-based organization with default + custom categories
- Search and filtering (case-insensitive, partial matching, combinable filters)
- Status tracking (todo/done) with visual distinction
- Responsive design (320px-2560px viewports)
- Cross-device data synchronization

**Technical Approach**:
- Modern React app with Next.js 15 App Router
- Supabase for authentication, database (Postgres), and real-time sync
- Tailwind CSS 4 for responsive utility-first styling
- Feature-based architecture with clear separation of concerns
- LocalStorage caching for perceived performance
- Manual testing workflow with visual QA

## Technical Context

**Language/Version**: TypeScript 5.x + JavaScript (ES2022), Node.js 20+
**Primary Dependencies**: Next.js 15, React 19, Tailwind CSS 4, Supabase Client SDK, Lucide Icons, Framer Motion
**Storage**: PostgreSQL (managed by Supabase) + browser LocalStorage for caching
**Testing**: None (manual testing only per constitution)
**Target Platform**: Web browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge - last 2 years), mobile-responsive
**Project Type**: Web application (frontend with backend-as-a-service)
**Performance Goals**: <1s page loads, <100ms user action feedback, <1s search results (up to 500 items)
**Constraints**: Solo developer, manual testing only, no automated tests, no third-party analytics
**Scale/Scope**: ~100 concurrent users initially, unlimited items per user, 7 user stories (3 P1, 2 P2, 2 P3)

## Constitution Check

*GATE: Must pass before Phase 0 research. Re-check after Phase 1 design.*

### I. Clean Code ✅ PASS

**Requirement**: Code must prioritize readability, consistency, and maintainability.

**Compliance**:
- TypeScript enforces type safety and clear interfaces
- Feature-based architecture separates concerns logically (`/features/todos`, `/features/auth`)
- ESLint + Prettier enforce consistent code style
- Component naming follows clear conventions (e.g., `TodoList`, `TodoForm`, `AuthForm`)
- Utility functions isolated in `/lib` for reusability

**Justification**: TypeScript + modern tooling naturally promotes clean code practices.

### II. Simple & Intuitive UX ✅ PASS

**Requirement**: Minimize friction and cognitive load; every action should be obvious.

**Compliance**:
- Primary actions (add item, mark done) achievable in ≤3 taps/clicks
- Clear visual affordances (buttons, inputs, interactive states)
- Immediate feedback on all user actions (<100ms)
- Helpful validation messages guide users toward success
- Single-purpose screens (list view, add/edit form, auth screens)

**Justification**: User stories prioritize speed of capture and minimal friction. UI design focuses on clarity.

### III. Fully Responsive Design ✅ PASS

**Requirement**: Graceful adaptation across mobile (320px+), tablet (768px+), desktop (1024px+).

**Compliance**:
- Tailwind CSS mobile-first approach with responsive utilities
- Touch targets ≥44px on mobile per NFR-007
- Fluid layouts using relative units and flex/grid
- Single-column mobile layout, multi-column desktop where appropriate
- Tested across viewport sizes 320px-2560px

**Justification**: Tailwind CSS 4 + mobile-first design system ensures responsive design is built-in.

### IV. Manual Testing Only (NON-NEGOTIABLE) ✅ PASS

**Requirement**: NO automated testing of any kind.

**Compliance**:
- No test frameworks installed (no Jest, Vitest, Playwright, Cypress)
- No `*.test.*`, `*.spec.*`, or `__tests__/` files created
- Manual testing workflow documented in quickstart.md
- Visual QA on multiple devices and screen sizes
- Developer responsible for testing all scenarios before commit

**Justification**: Constitution explicitly forbids automated testing. All validation is manual.

### V. Privacy Through Authentication ✅ PASS

**Requirement**: Authentication required; data private and secure.

**Compliance**:
- Supabase Auth enforces authentication before any data access
- Row-Level Security (RLS) policies ensure users only see their own data
- Passwords hashed (bcrypt via Supabase)
- Session management handled securely by Supabase
- No third-party analytics or tracking tools
- HTTPS enforced via Vercel deployment

**Justification**: Supabase provides enterprise-grade authentication and RLS out of the box.

**Constitution Check Result**: ✅ **ALL GATES PASS** - No violations. Proceed to Phase 0.

### Source Code (repository root)

```text
/
├── app/                      # Next.js 15 App Router
│   ├── layout.tsx            # Root layout with providers
│   ├── page.tsx              # Home/redirect to /todos
│   ├── (auth)/               # Auth route group
│   │   ├── login/
│   │   │   └── page.tsx

│       ├── Header.tsx
│       └── Container.tsx

├── features/                 # Feature-specific logic
│   ├── auth/
│   │   ├── components/
│   │   │   ├── LoginForm.tsx
│   │   │   └── SignupForm.tsx
│   │   ├── hooks/
│   │   │   └── useAuth.ts
│   │   └── actions.ts        # Server actions for auth
│   │
│   └── todos/
│       ├── components/
│       │   ├── TodoList.tsx
│       │   ├── TodoItem.tsx
│       │   ├── TodoForm.tsx
│       │   ├── CategoryFilter.tsx

│       │   └── SearchBar.tsx
│       ├── hooks/
│       │   ├── useTodos.ts
│       │   ├── useCategories.ts
│       │   └── useFilters.ts
│       ├── types.ts
│       └── actions.ts        # Server actions for todos
│
├── lib/                      # Utilities and shared logic
│   ├── supabase/
│   │   ├── client.ts         # Supabase client (browser)
│   │   ├── server.ts         # Supabase client (server)
│   │   └── types.ts          # Database types (generated)
│   ├── storage.ts            # LocalStorage utilities
│   ├── filters.ts            # Search/filter logic
│   └── utils.ts              # General utilities
│
├── public/                   # Static assets
├── specs/                    # SpecKit documentation
├── .env.local                # Environment variables (gitignored)
├── package.json
├── tsconfig.json
├── tailwind.config.ts
├── next.config.js
└── README.md
```

**Structure Decision**:

Chose **Web application** structure (Option 2 variation) with Next.js App Router conventions. This structure provides:

1. **Feature-based organization**: Each feature (`auth`, `todos`) is self-contained with its own components, hooks, and actions
2. **Clear separation of concerns**: UI primitives in `/components`, business logic in `/features`, utilities in `/lib`
3. **Next.js 15 conventions**: App Router with route groups for authenticated vs. public routes
4. **Scalability**: Easy to add new features (e.g., `/features/categories`, `/features/settings`) without restructuring
5. **No test directories**: Honors Manual Testing Only principle - no `tests/`, `__tests__/`, or `*.test.*` files

**NOTE**: Tests directories from template removed entirely per Constitution Principle IV.
